    private void jButton1ActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {                                         
        // TODO add your handling code here:
        JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(this, "Option Selected");
            
            this.setVisible(false);
            encrypt m = new encrypt();
            m.setVisible(true);
    }                                        

    private void jButton2ActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {                                         
        // TODO add your handling code here:
        int x = JOptionPane.showConfirmDialog(null, "Are you sure close application","Warning Message", JOptionPane.YES_NO_OPTION);
        
        if(x == 0){
            System.exit(0);
            
        }
    }                                        

    private void jButton3ActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {                                         
        // TODO add your handling code here:
        // Decrypt button action
    String key = new String(jPasswordField1.getPassword());
    String ciphertext = jTextField1.getText();

    if (key.isEmpty()) {
        JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(this, "Please enter a key.");
        return;
    }

    if (ciphertext.isEmpty()) {
        JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(this, "Please enter the ciphertext to decrypt.");
        return;
    }

    // Perform decryption steps
    try {
        // Call decrypt method to get plaintext
        String plaintext = decrypt(key, ciphertext);

        // Display the plaintext in the output field
        jTextField2.setText(plaintext);
    } catch (Exception ex) {
        JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(this, "Decryption failed: " + ex.getMessage());
    }
    }                                        
    
    
    private String decrypt(String key, String ciphertext) {
    // Step I: Convert each character of ciphertext to its ASCII value, reverse shuffle, and append to reversed text
    StringBuilder reversedTextBuilder = new StringBuilder();
    for (int i = 0; i < ciphertext.length(); i++) {
        char c = ciphertext.charAt(i);
        int asciiValue = (int) c;
        asciiValue += 2; // Shift two positions to the right to reverse the earlier encryption
        reversedTextBuilder.append((char)asciiValue);
    }
    
    
    
    // Step II: Reverse the reversed text to get the original combined text
    String combinedText = reversedTextBuilder.reverse().toString();
    
    // Step III: Split combined text using key using XOR to get plaintext
    String plaintext = xorStrings(combinedText, key);
    
    return plaintext;
    }

    // Method to XOR two strings
    private String xorStrings(String s1, String s2) {
        StringBuilder result = new StringBuilder();
        for (int i = 0; i < s1.length(); i++) {
            result.append((char)(s1.charAt(i) ^ s2.charAt(i % s2.length())));
        }
        return result.toString();
    }

     * @param args the command line arguments
     */
